2 import data

churn_data_raw <- read_csv("datas/WA_Fn-UseC_-Telco-Customer-Churn.csv")

3 preprocessing

churn_data_tbl <- churn_data_raw %>%
                  select(-customerID) %>%
                  na.omit(churn_data_raw$TotalCharges) %>%
                  select(Churn, everything())

#churn_data_tbl

4 split 80/20

# Split test/training sets
set.seed(100)

train_test_split <- rsample::initial_split(churn_data_tbl, prop = 0.8)
train_test_split
#> <Training/Testing/Total>
#> <5625/1407/7032>
## <Analysis/Assess/Total>
## <5626/1406/7032>

# Retrieve train and test sets
train_tbl <- training(train_test_split)
test_tbl  <- testing(train_test_split)
churn_data_tbl %>% ggplot(aes(x = tenure)) + 
  geom_histogram(bins = 6, color = "white", fill =  "#2DC6D6") +
  labs(
    title = "Tenure Counts With Six Bins",
    x     = "tenure (month)"
  )
# Determine if log transformation improves correlation 
# between TotalCharges and Churn

train_tbl %>%
    select(Churn, TotalCharges) %>%
    mutate(
        Churn = Churn %>% as.factor() %>% as.numeric(),
        LogTotalCharges = log(TotalCharges)
        ) %>%
    correlate() %>%
    focus(Churn) %>%
    fashion()
#> Correlation computed with
#> • Method: 'pearson'
#> • Missing treated using: 'pairwise.complete.obs'
churn_data_tbl %>% 
        pivot_longer(cols      = c(Contract, InternetService, MultipleLines, PaymentMethod), 
                     names_to  = "feature", 
                     values_to = "category") %>% 
        ggplot(aes(category)) +
          geom_bar(fill = "#2DC6D6") +
          facet_wrap(~ feature, scales = "free") +
          labs(
            title = "Features with multiple categories: Need to be one-hot encoded"
          ) +
          theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 25, 
                                           hjust = 1))

5 Preprocessing with recipes

rec_obj <- recipe(Churn ~ ., data = train_tbl) %>%
    step_rm(Churn) %>% 
    step_discretize(tenure, options = list(cuts = 6)) %>%
    step_log(TotalCharges) %>%
    step_dummy(all_nominal(), -all_outcomes(), one_hot = T) %>%
    step_center(all_predictors(), -all_outcomes()) %>%
    step_scale(all_predictors(), -all_outcomes()) %>%
    prep(data = train_tbl)

6 Bake

# Predictors
x_train_tbl <- bake(rec_obj , new_data = train_tbl )
x_test_tbl  <- bake(rec_obj , new_data = test_tbl )
# Response variables for training and testing sets
y_train_vec <- ifelse(churn_data_tbl$Churn == "Yes", 1, 0)
y_test_vec  <- ifelse(test_tbl$Churn == "Yes", 1, 0)

7 ANN

8 Building our Artificial Neural Network

model_keras <- keras_model_sequential()

model_keras %>% # First hidden layer layer_dense( units = 16, kernel_initializer = “uniform”, activation = “relu”, input_shape = ncol(x_train_tbl)) %>% # Dropout to prevent overfitting layer_dropout(rate = 0.1) %>% # Second hidden layer layer_dense( units = 16, kernel_initializer = “uniform”, activation = “relu”) %>% # Dropout to prevent overfitting layer_dropout(rate = 0.1) %>% # Output layer layer_dense( units = 1, kernel_initializer = “uniform”, activation = “sigmoid”) %>% # Compile ANN compile( optimizer = ‘adam’, loss = ‘binary_crossentropy’, metrics = c(‘accuracy’) ) model_keras

9 Training

10 Fit the keras model to the training data

fit_keras <- fit( model_keras, x = as.matrix(x_train_tbl), y = y_train_vec, batch_size = 50, epochs = 35, validation_split = 0.3 )

fit_keras

11 Plot

12 Plot the training/validation history of our Keras model

plot(fit_keras) + #geom_smooth(formula = y ~ x, method = “auto”, se = FALSE, color = “blue”) + labs(title = “Deep Learning Training Results”) + theme(legend.position = “bottom”, strip.placement = “inside”, strip.background = element_rect(fill = “grey”))

13 make predictions

  • tensorflow version is different, therefore the code has been adjusted

14 Predicted Class

#yhat_keras_class_vec <- predict_classes(object = model_keras, x = as.matrix(x_test_tbl)) %>% # as.vector()

15 Predicted Class Probability

#yhat_keras_prob_vec <- predict_proba(object = model_keras, x = as.matrix(x_test_tbl)) %>% # as.vector()

16 Predicted Class

yhat_keras_class_vec <- predict(object = model_keras, x = as.matrix(x_test_tbl)) %>% k_argmax() %>% as.vector()

17 Predicted Class Probability

yhat_keras_prob_vec <- predict(object = model_keras, x = as.matrix(x_test_tbl)) %>% as.vector()

18 Inspect performance

estimates_keras_tbl <- tibble( truth = as.factor(y_test_vec) %>% fct_recode(yes = “1”, no = “0”), estimate = as.factor(yhat_keras_class_vec) %>% fct_recode(yes = “1”, no = “0”), class_prob = yhat_keras_prob_vec )

estimates_keras_tbl
